objective: How to make a deep research feature for code bases

sub_tasks.task: Define scope, target users and detailed requirements of a deep research feature (e.g., supported languages, use cases, query types) through stakeholder interviews and surveys
Survey and benchmark existing code search and analysis platforms (e.g., Sourcegraph, GitHub Code Search, OpenGrok) for strengths, weaknesses, and feature gaps
Conduct academic literature review on program comprehension, semantic code search and summarization (sources: ArXiv, Google Scholar, IEEE Xplore)
Investigate technical approaches for semantic code understanding: static/dynamic analysis, ASTs, code embeddings (CodeBERT, code2vec), graph neural networks
Design an indexing pipeline: tokenization, metadata extraction (file paths, version history), embedding generation and storage
Evaluate vector search and database solutions (e.g., Pinecone, FAISS, ElasticSearch vector plugin) for scalability and retrieval speed
Draft UI/UX mockups for interactive query input, result filtering, snippet preview and navigation (tools: Figma, Adobe XD)
Plan IDE/editor integration strategy (e.g., VSCode extension, JetBrains plugin) including APIs and live feedback mechanisms
Define evaluation metrics and benchmarks (precision, recall, latency, user satisfaction) and create a test suite using open-source corpora (GitHub public repos)
Identify potential knowledge gaps (polyglot support, context understanding, scalability) and propose research experiments to address them
